# tintColor

**Instance Property**

The tint color to apply to the button item.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var tintColor: UIColor? { get set }
```

## Discussion

In iOS 7 and later, all subclasses of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView] derive their behavior for [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView/tintColor] from the base class. Although [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIBarButtonItem] isn’t a view, its [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIBarButtonItem/tintColor] property behaves the same as that of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView]. See the discussion of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView/tintColor] in [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView] for more information.

## Customizing item appearance

- **style**: The style of the item.
- **UIBarButtonItem.Style**: Constants that specify the style of an item.
- **isHidden**: A Boolean that determines the visibility of the item.
- **isSelected**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the button is in a selected state.
- **width**: The width of the item.
- **possibleTitles**: The set of possible titles to display on the bar button.
